actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to delay the effective date of any variation in the compensation of Senators and Representatives until after an election of Representives has intervened and the terms for Representatives chosen in such election have begun.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits any law varying the compensation of Members of Congress from taking effect until an election of Representatives has intervened and the terms for the Representatives have begun.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to delay the effective date of any variation in the compensation of Senators and Representatives until after an election of Representives has intervened and the terms for Representatives chosen in such election have begun.
